page.title: 09Annual Events, Bridgham
page.content:
Every year, Bridgham has a bonfire on November 5th. People bring their own fireworks and refreshments are available. Before Christmas, St. John's Cadets call on every house in the village, carol-singing, to raise money for their funds - and villagers are invited to The Grove for a traditional carol-singing evening, with mince pies and coffee.
At the Village Hall, there are dances, dart matches, pool tournaments, whist drives and bingo (held in aid of village organisations) and entertainment evenings throughout the year. Jumble sales and fairs are run by the Playing Fields Committee and St. John's Cadets. The Church holds special Harvest Festival, Remembrance Day, Christmas and Easter services.
